thread.section_title: Broward County High School Sports - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Howling winds no match for Dillard's Gill, Pine Crest and Westminster
thread.title_full: Howling winds no match for Dillard's Gill, Pine Crest and Westminster - Sun Sentinel

author: Patrick Maks
title: Howling winds no match for Dillard's Gill, Pine Crest and Westminster
text:
The wind was howling, but nothing could slow down Brittany Gill.
The Dillard senior finished first in the 15-3A girls district championships with a time of 18:57.82, outpacing her closest competition by almost three minutes.
"At first the wind was kind of a letdown," Gill said. "But I still pushed myself."
On a day dominated by Pine Crest and Westminster Academy — two cross country powerhouses that swept their races in 15-2A and 14-1A, respectively — Gill's performance turned heads Thursday at Mills Pond Park.
In her first year running cross country, Gill is quickly making a name for herself.
Last week, Gill won the girls race at the Broward County Athletic Association championships, unseating three-time defending champion Alexa Cruz. In September, she edged defending state champ and Pine Crest eighth-grader Tsion Yared at the Pine Crest Cross Country Invitational.
Cross Country District Championships featuring District 15 3A, District 14 1A and District 15 2A.
(Taimy Alvarez) So what's next?
"My mindset is to finish the fastest I can by state," Gill said, who added she wants to help Dillard set a foundation for future success.
Gill and the Panthers — whose girls placed third behind Northeast and Boyd Anderson — will compete at regionals next week.
Still, few teams were as impressive as Pine Crest, which placed six runners in the top eight of the girls race and seven in the top 15 for boys.
Senior Alyssa Pujals placed first with a time of 18:48.62, while two-time state champ Julia Montgomery (19:05.61) and Yared (20:01.99) rounded out the top three finishers. Pine Crest will compete at regionals along with Cardinal Gibbons (second place, 65 points) and Calvary Christian (third, 84 points) in the girls races.
In the boys race, Pine Crest junior Michael Kennedy (16:22.80) placed second behind Calvary Christian sophomore Alberto Ferro (16;21.79), while Pine Crest senior Michael Welch (16:47.53) took third. Pine Crest will be joined at regionals by Calvary Christian, which finished second, and third-place finisher Archbishop McCarthy.
"The training we had this week was probably some of the best work I've ever had put forth by a group," Pine Crest coach Paul Baur said.
In 14-1A, Westminster Academy swept the boys and girls races.
"We're year-round runners," Westminster coach Ken Key said. "We take it seriously, they know what it takes, they've been there before."
Five girls for the Lions placed in the race's top eight, including eighth-grader Christina Bell (22:47.97), seventh-grader Ashley Williams, freshmen Drew Franta and Ragan Jacaty and sophomore Dawn Erlich. Coral Springs Christian and Sagemont rounded out the top three and also will advance.
Westminster's boys were equally dominant: junior Patrick Sastre placed first (17:59.23), while eighth-grader Benjamin DeAngulo, senior Daniel Wood and sophomore Joshua DeAngulo rounded out the top five. Coral Springs Christian and South Florida HEAT also reached regionals.
In 15-3A, Boyd Anderson won for the boys, Dillard placed second and Blanche Ely took third. Dillard senior Michael Noltion finished first (17:46.47), Boyd Anderson sophomore Kendarius Coward and Dillard junior John Sellars took second and third, respectively.
Meanwhile, Northeast placed first for the girls. The Hurricanes will compete at regionals with second-place Boyd Anderson and third-place Dillard.
